Sparring for Unseen traits (was: Aggrevating)
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Advance 2 Archive (GameBoy Advance): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Sparring for Unseen traits (was: Aggrevating)
By Seize on Saturday, February 22, 2003 - 04:04 pm:

D'oh!
Here's the scenario. After training an octopee/octopee a while back (yep that one with Up IQ) I thought I'd try a dragon/dragon to see which made the better expedition monster (they both have good Life and Int). I was taking a break from recording which-items-found-where in Malt and went Sparring (sale!).

Dragon/Dragon, 3Y 8M, Reliance 100, style Normal, figure Slim
Stat levels P19,I14,A8,S1,D8,L14
Up Fire, Up Earth, Popular, Up Mind, NearSght,-empty-

Trained for Speed (chances were "Good") to get Wing Blade. I used the Agima coach "Teacher" (the provided hare) that has only Forsee.
I got the attack and a new trait.
"Hi Speed" !!!
GREAT that dragon needs speed like no tomorrow! Took the dragon to the hospital to get rid of NearSght (been meaning to do that) and while waiting the bateries died! D'oh! Luckily I saved just before sparring...but I can't seem to get that trait again!

Has anyone else been told by Holly that they've aquired a new trait while sparring and found out that its a trait the coach didn't even have!?!?

By GoldenBoy on Saturday, February 22, 2003 - 04:14 pm:

No, but certainly post again if you can get it to happen again.

By Kurasu Soratobu on Thursday, March 6, 2003 - 08:30 pm:

I just wanted to add my experiences. Trained a golem/golem with a Ring Rock, for power. My chances were 'good' to recieve a move. I recieved the move, and also got Hi-Power (like a golem needs this?).

The Ring Rock had Success, Rockskin, and Up Mind. No Charisma, no Hi-Power.

Its stats were: 825/113/883/118/768/840

By Kurasu Soratobu on Thursday, March 6, 2003 - 08:34 pm:

I guess it might help if I mention what the golem itself had. It had Rockskin, Up Water, Up Mind, and Popular.

By Kurasu Soratobu on Friday, March 7, 2003 - 08:34 am:

And one more update: same golem, a few game-years later, trained with the basic speed trainer (the AGIMA hare). He got Hi-Speed. Had Rock Skin, Popular, Hi-Power, Dignity, and Up Water, and had a speed of less than 50.

Ironically enough, he was also my first monster to get Dignity on this new game. Very prolific critter.

By GoldenBoy on Friday, March 7, 2003 - 01:07 pm:

Good reports Kurasu. Traits in MRA2 are more complex than I first imagined. They give me headaches.

By i am ninja on Sunday, March 9, 2003 - 02:47 am:

I've gotten Hi IQ from sparring for INT.

By Infernus on Tuesday, March 11, 2003 - 04:39 pm:

Just got Hi Power on my Arrowhead from a coach with Hi Speed, Hi IQ, Hi Stamna, Charisma, Satori, self trained Hooligan. Monster had Up Ice, Satori, Tufshell, Glutton.

By Kurasu Soratobu on Sunday, March 16, 2003 - 04:45 pm:

A related (but slightly different) question: do the hi-traits pass on in training other than this exception? As in, if a trainer has Hi-Power, could he pass it on even if he's not training in power?

By GoldenBoy on Sunday, March 16, 2003 - 05:36 pm:

In training, no I have yet to see any Hi pass in drills. Sparring, which is what this exception is, yes.

By Zaketa on Tuesday, April 1, 2003 - 05:04 pm:

i think whatever (int. power. def., etc.) u spar for can give u the trait of Hi-(whatever u trained for) so someone while training in def. lif. or anything who gets Hi-anything please see if u can get another one

By Seize on Saturday, September 6, 2003 - 09:40 pm:
